org.eclipse.keyple.core.seproxy.plugin.reader

Class AbstractReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.keyple.core.seproxy.plugin.reader.AbstractReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ProxyReader, SeReader
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractLocalReader

    public abstract class AbstractReader
extends java.lang.Object
implements ProxyReader
    Abstract definition of an observable reader.
    • High level logging and benchmarking of Set of SeRequest and SeRequest transmission
    • Name-based comparison of ProxyReader (required for SortedSet<ProxyReader>)
    • Plugin naming management

      • getPluginName

        public final java.lang.String getPluginName()
        Gets the name of plugin provided in the constructor.

        The method will be used particularly for logging purposes. The plugin name is also part of the ReaderEvent and PluginEvent objects.

        Returns:
        the plugin name String

      • transmitSeRequests

        public final java.util.List<SeResponse> transmitSeRequests(java.util.List<SeRequest> seRequests,
                                                           MultiSeRequestProcessing multiSeRequestProcessing,
                                                           ChannelControl channelControl)
        Execute the transmission of a list of SeRequest and returns a list of SeResponse

        The MultiSeRequestProcessing parameter indicates whether all requests are to be sent regardless of their result (PROCESS_ALL) or whether the process should stop at the first request whose result is a success (FIRST_MATCH).

        The ChannelControl parameter specifies whether the physical channel should be closed (CLOSE_AFTER) or not (KEEP_OPEN) after all requests have been transmitted.

        The global execution time (inter-exchange and communication) and the Set of SeRequest content is logged (DEBUG level).

        As the method is final, it cannot be extended.

        Specified by:
        transmitSeRequests in interface ProxyReader
        Parameters:
        seRequests - the request set
        multiSeRequestProcessing - the multi SE request processing mode
        channelControl - the channel control indicator
        Returns:
        the response set
        Throws:
        KeypleReaderIOException - if the communication with the reader or the SE has failed

      • processSeRequests

        protected abstract java.util.List<SeResponse> processSeRequests(java.util.List<SeRequest> seRequests,
                                                                MultiSeRequestProcessing multiSeRequestProcessing,
                                                                ChannelControl channelControl)
        Abstract method implemented by the AbstractLocalReader and VirtualReader classes.

        This method is handled by transmitSet.

        Parameters:
        seRequests - a List of SeRequest to be processed
        multiSeRequestProcessing - the multi se processing mode
        channelControl - indicates if the channel has to be closed at the end of the processing
        Returns:
        the List of SeResponse (responses to the Set of SeRequest)
        Throws:
        KeypleReaderIOException - if the communication with the reader or the SE has failed

      • transmitSeRequest

        public final SeResponse transmitSeRequest(SeRequest seRequest,
                                          ChannelControl channelControl)
        Execute the transmission of a SeRequest and returns a SeResponse

        The individual execution time (inter-exchange and communication) and the SeRequest content is logged (DEBUG level).

        As the method is final, it cannot be extended.

        Specified by:
        transmitSeRequest in interface ProxyReader
        Parameters:
        seRequest - the request to be transmitted
        channelControl - indicates if the channel has to be closed at the end of the processing
        Returns:
        the received response
        Throws:
        KeypleReaderIOException - if the communication with the reader or the SE has failed

      • processSeRequest

        protected abstract SeResponse processSeRequest(SeRequest seRequest,
                                               ChannelControl channelControl)
        Abstract method implemented by the AbstractLocalReader and VirtualReader classes.

        This method is handled by transmit.

        Parameters:
        seRequest - the SeRequest to be processed
        channelControl - a flag indicating if the channel has to be closed after the processing of the SeRequest
        Returns:
        the SeResponse (responses to the SeRequest)
        Throws:
        KeypleReaderIOException - if the communication with the reader or the SE has failed

      • setParameters

        public final void setParameters(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters)

        See setParameter(String, String) for more details

        Parameters:

        Throws:

      • setParameter

        public void setParameter(java.lang.String key,
                         java.lang.String value)
        allows to define a proprietary setting for a reader or a plugin (contactless protocols polling sequence, baud rate, … etc.).
        Parameters:
        key - the parameter key
        value - the parameter value
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the parameter or the value is not supported
